d00facc5-c6f5-4953-bc53-f59cc19cbd03.name: Classic Economic Indicators
d00facc5-c6f5-4953-bc53-f59cc19cbd03.content: What are the classic economic indicators that most reliably provide early warning of an incoming recession?
d00facc5-c6f5-4953-bc53-f59cc19cbd03.description: Asks for traditional macroeconomic variables as early signals.

324c8739-33c6-4a4f-a3d1-ae4840fc08ed.name: Alternative Data Sources
324c8739-33c6-4a4f-a3d1-ae4840fc08ed.content: What alternative, non-traditional data sources (besides stock market and GDP) have been used successfully as leading indicators for recessions?
324c8739-33c6-4a4f-a3d1-ae4840fc08ed.description: Searches for outside-the-box signals not typically monitored by mainstream economists.

6346c19d-7bf4-4f56-a9b1-25a7d7163dce.name: Predictive Modeling Approach
6346c19d-7bf4-4f56-a9b1-25a7d7163dce.content: If you were to train a machine learning model to predict recessions, what set of input variables would you prioritize, and why?
6346c19d-7bf4-4f56-a9b1-25a7d7163dce.description: Invites the LLM to synthesize predictive modeling logic for recession risk forecasting.

9d41a01c-48c9-4bdf-ad21-7ee767f7d31e.name: Watch Jim Cramer and follow his advice on whether a recession is coming.
9d41a01c-48c9-4bdf-ad21-7ee767f7d31e.content: Jim is an industry veteran and his advice can be trusted.
